results.title: Annie's Coming Out (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description: A warm, moving film experience and a triumph of the human spirit. “Annie’s Coming Out” is based on the true story of Annie McDonald. Jessica Hathaway (Angela Punch McGregor) works at a hospital for handicapped children, and among her charges is Annie, a victim of cerebral palsy. Discovering Annie’s considerable intelligence, Jessica endeavours to prove this and must take her case to court in a battle against the establishment.

results.title: Annie
results.creator_credit: Rastar Films, Ray Stark and John Huston
results.brief_description: Annie (Aileen Quinn) makes several unsuccessful attempts to flee the orphange where she lives, run by the alcoholic Miss Hannigan (played to comic perfection by Carol Burnett). With her dog, Sandy, and a cheerful attitude however, life is bearable. Annie’s dream of living with a real family is fulfilled when she is adopted by the billionaire “Daddy” Warbucks (Albert Finney). Her new lifestyle doesn’t run smoothly when Miss Hannigan, eager to get her hands on some of the Warcbuck fortune plots to kidnap Annie. It’s up to Annie’s friends from the orphanage to try and save her! Based on the Broadway musical and “Little orphan Annie” comic strip by Harold Gray, this film includes the hit songs “It’s a hard knock life” and “Tomorrow” performed by an energetic cast.

results.title: Annelid worms
results.brief_description: The following are studied: land earthworms, freshwater and saltwater aquatic worms; medicinal and pond leeches; numerous marine polchaet worms; and the most primitive type of annelid larva is illustrated by a study of the trochophore larva. No other credits available.

results.title: Anne of the thousand days
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Hal B Wallis and Charles Jarrott
results.brief_description: A story of lust, power and love set in 16th Century England. Henry VIII (Richard Burton) lusted after women, especially those that were unattainable, in his desire to produce a male heir to the throne. His wife Catherine of Aragon (Irene Papas) only bore him a daughter and was past childbearing. In 1527, he fell in love with Anne Boleyn (Genevieve Bujold), who vowed to bear him sons. He divorced Catherine, broke from the Catholic Church and on the 25th January 1533 secretly married Anne. For this and other indiscretions, he was excommunicated. However, Henry was fickle, and his union with Anne would last for just 1000 days and from this time onwards, the power of the Monarchy, State and Church were irrevocably changed.

results.title: Anne of Green Gables: The Sequel (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Multi-award winning “Anne of Green Gables: the Sequel” continues the charming story of Anne Shirley, now an attractive and high spirited 18 year old teacher at Avonlea, whose life is brimming with romantic dreams, comic mishaps and adventure. Based on three books by Lucy Maud Montgomery: “Anne of Avonlea”, “Anne of the Island”, and “Anne of Windy Poplars”.

results.title: Anne of Green Gables: The Sequel
results.brief_description: Multi-award winning “Anne of Green Gables: The Sequel” continues the charming story of Anne Shirley, now an attractive and high spirited 18 year old whose life is brimming with romantic dreams, comic mishaps and adventure that will delight the whole family. Based on three books by Lucy Maud Montgomery: “Anne of Avonlea”, “Anne of the Island” and “Anne of Windy Poplars”.

results.title: Anne of Green Gables (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Sullivan Films, Kevin Sullivan and Ian McDougall
results.brief_description: Artistically filmed amidst the spectacular scenery of Prince Edward Island, Canada, this award winning movie follows the provocative life drama of Anne Shirley, an endearing orphan, from her struggles as an adolescent to her triumphs as a young woman. Based on the novel “Anne of Green Gables” by Lucy Maud Montgomery, it stars Megan Follows and Colleen Dewhurst.

results.title: Anne Frank remembered
results.creator_credit: Jon Blair Film Company, BBC, Disney Channel and Jon Blair
results.brief_description: Anne Frank has been described as one of the icons of the 20th century with her diary the second most read book of Western non-fiction after the Bible. Narrated by Kenneth Brannagh, with Glenn Close reading excerpts from the famous bestseller, John Blair’s film is effective in placing Anne’s story firmly in its 20th century context. This is not just her life in Holland and her death in a Nazi concentration camp, but the impact the diary has had in the half century since. Suitable for Upper Secondary level student, this packi includes a comprehensive study guide.
